description: A synchronization attempt failed.
objects.test: $SNMPTRAPCMD EXTREME-VM-MIB::extremeVMVPPSyncFailed EXTREME-VM-MIB::extremeVMFTPServer s EXAMPLE EXTREME-VM-MIB::extremeVMFTPAddrType i 0 EXTREME-VM-MIB::extremeVMFTPServerType i 1 EXTREME-VM-MIB::extremeVMLastSynchStatus i 1 EXTREME-VM-MIB::extremeVMVPPName s EXAMPLE EXTREME-VM-MIB::extremeVMVPPSynchType i 1

description: The IP Address of the FTP server used for transferring various management files.
variables.name: EXTREME-VM-MIB::extremeVMFTPServer

description: The IP type of IP address.
variables.name: EXTREME-VM-MIB::extremeVMFTPAddrType

description: The type of the FTP server. The backup server is contacted if the primary fails to respond.
variables.name: EXTREME-VM-MIB::extremeVMFTPServerType

description: The result of the most recent synchronization attempt.
success(1) - indicates that the synchronization completed successfully
accessDenied(2) - The username and password were not accepted by the server
serverTimeout(3) - Could not establish a file transfer session with the configured server
serverNotConfigured(4) - The server configuration is not complete
variables.name: EXTREME-VM-MIB::extremeVMLastSynchStatus

description: The name of the Port VPP. VPP names must be alpha-numeric and must start with an alpha character.
variables.name: EXTREME-VM-MIB::extremeVMVPPName

description: Indicates the type of policy
variables.name: EXTREME-VM-MIB::extremeVMVPPSynchType

description: A virutal port profile definition is invalid, indicating it cannot be applied to a port.

event.Summary: Virtual port profile $v2 definition is invalid

objects.test: $SNMPTRAPCMD EXTREME-VM-MIB::extremeVMVPPInvalid EXTREME-VM-MIB::extremeVMVPPType i 1 EXTREME-VM-MIB::extremeVMVPPName s EXAMPLE

description: The type of the port profile. Network port profiles are obtained from a central policy store.
Local policies are specific to this particular switch.
variables.name: EXTREME-VM-MIB::extremeVMVPPType

description: The name of the Port VPP. VPP names must be alpha-numeric and must start with an alpha character.
variables.name: EXTREME-VM-MIB::extremeVMVPPName

description: This notification is generated whenever a MAC is manually mapped to a local policy.

event.Summary: MAC address $v1 is manually mapped to a local policy

objects.test: $SNMPTRAPCMD EXTREME-VM-MIB::extremeVMMapped EXTREME-VM-MIB::extremeVMMappingMAC s EXAMPL EXTREME-VM-MIB::extremeVMMappingIngressVPPName s EXAMPLE EXTREME-VM-MIB::extremeVMMappingEgressVPPName s EXAMPLE EXTREME-VM-MIB::extremeVMMappingVPPName s EXAMPLE

description: The MAC address associated with the Virtual Machine. Note that a VM may have multiple MAC addresses.
variables.name: EXTREME-VM-MIB::extremeVMMappingMAC

description: The ingress policy associated with the VM/MAC address. Note that this may refer to a policy without
a corresponding entry in the extremeVMVPPTable if a network policy mapping refers to a non-existent policy.
This would indicate an error in the policy mapping file that is consulted if network authentication fails.
When creating an entry in this table, this name must refer to an existing, valid, local policy. The creation of
a mapping to a network policy is not permitted. Those mappings must be created at the central policy server.
variables.name: EXTREME-VM-MIB::extremeVMMappingIngressVPPName

description: The egress policy associated with the VM/MAC address. Note that this may refer to a policy without
a corresponding entry in the extremeVMVPPTable if a network policy mapping refers to a non-existent policy.
This would indicate an error in the policy mapping file that is consulted if network authentication fails.
When creating an entry in this table, this name must refer to an existing, valid, local policy. The creation of
a mapping to a network policy is not permitted. Those mappings must be created at the central policy server.
variables.name: EXTREME-VM-MIB::extremeVMMappingEgressVPPName

description: The virtual port profile associated with the VM/MAC address.
When creating an entry in this table, this name must refer to
an existing, valid, local profile.
The creation of a mapping to a network profile is not permitted.
Those mappings must be created at the central policy server.
variables.name: EXTREME-VM-MIB::extremeVMMappingVPPName

description: This notification is generated whenever a MAC is manually unmapped to a local policy.

event.Summary: MAC address $v1 is manually unmapped to a local policy

objects.test: $SNMPTRAPCMD EXTREME-VM-MIB::extremeVMUnMapped EXTREME-VM-MIB::extremeVMMappingMAC s EXAMPL EXTREME-VM-MIB::extremeVMMappingIngressVPPName s EXAMPLE EXTREME-VM-MIB::extremeVMMappingEgressVPPName s EXAMPLE EXTREME-VM-MIB::extremeVMMappingVPPName s EXAMPLE

description: The MAC address associated with the Virtual Machine. Note that a VM may have multiple MAC addresses.
variables.name: EXTREME-VM-MIB::extremeVMMappingMAC

description: The ingress policy associated with the VM/MAC address. Note that this may refer to a policy without
a corresponding entry in the extremeVMVPPTable if a network policy mapping refers to a non-existent policy.
This would indicate an error in the policy mapping file that is consulted if network authentication fails.
When creating an entry in this table, this name must refer to an existing, valid, local policy. The creation of
a mapping to a network policy is not permitted. Those mappings must be created at the central policy server.
variables.name: EXTREME-VM-MIB::extremeVMMappingIngressVPPName

description: The egress policy associated with the VM/MAC address. Note that this may refer to a policy without
a corresponding entry in the extremeVMVPPTable if a network policy mapping refers to a non-existent policy.
This would indicate an error in the policy mapping file that is consulted if network authentication fails.
When creating an entry in this table, this name must refer to an existing, valid, local policy. The creation of
a mapping to a network policy is not permitted. Those mappings must be created at the central policy server.
variables.name: EXTREME-VM-MIB::extremeVMMappingEgressVPPName

description: The virtual port profile associated with the VM/MAC address.
When creating an entry in this table, this name must refer to
an existing, valid, local profile.
The creation of a mapping to a network profile is not permitted.
Those mappings must be created at the central policy server.
variables.name: EXTREME-VM-MIB::extremeVMMappingVPPName

description: This notification is generated after a VM is detected on a port and reflects the result of that operation.
objects.test: $SNMPTRAPCMD EXTREME-VM-MIB::extremeVMDetectResult EXTREME-VM-MIB::extremeVMDetectedMAC s EXAMPL EXTREME-VM-MIB::extremeVMDetectedIfIndex i 9999 EXTREME-VM-MIB::extremeVMDetectedIngressVPPName s EXAMPLE EXTREME-VM-MIB::extremeVMDetectedEgressVPPName s EXAMPLE EXTREME-VM-MIB::extremeVMDetectedResultIngress i 1 EXTREME-VM-MIB::extremeVMDetectedResultEgress i 1 EXTREME-VM-MIB::extremeVMDetectedOperStatus i 1 EXTREME-VM-MIB::extremeVMDetectedIngErrPolicies s EXAMPLE EXTREME-VM-MIB::extremeVMDetectedEgrErrPolicies s EXAMPLE EXTREME-VM-MIB::extremeVMDetectedVPPResult i 1 EXTREME-VM-MIB::extremeVMDetectedVPPName s EXAMPLE EXTREME-VM-MIB::extremeVMDetectedCounterInstallResult i 0

description: The MAC address associated with the Virtual Machine. Note that a VM may have multiple MAC addresses.
variables.name: EXTREME-VM-MIB::extremeVMDetectedMAC

description: The value of ifIndex on which this virtual machine was detected.
variables.name: EXTREME-VM-MIB::extremeVMDetectedIfIndex

description: The name of the policy applied (or attempted to apply) to this virtual machine.
variables.name: EXTREME-VM-MIB::extremeVMDetectedIngressVPPName

description: The name of the policy applied (or attempted to apply) to this virtual machine.
variables.name: EXTREME-VM-MIB::extremeVMDetectedEgressVPPName

description: Indicates the result of a VM entry into the network.
Only below two values will be returned at any point of time.
policyApplied(1) - all the ingress policies in the VPP was successfully applied to the port.
policyNotApplied(2) - If any one of the ingress policies in the VPP was not applied to the port.
If this value is returned then refer to extremeVMDetectedIngErrPolicies object for
list of failed ingress policies.
variables.name: EXTREME-VM-MIB::extremeVMDetectedResultIngress

description: Indicates the result of a VM entry into the network.
Only below two values will be returned at any point of time.
policyApplied(1) - all the egress policies in the VPP was successfully applied to the port.
policyNotApplied(2) - If any one of the egress policies in the VPP was not applied to the port.
If this value is returned then refer to extremeVMDetectedEgrErrPolicies object for
list of failed egress policies.
variables.name: EXTREME-VM-MIB::extremeVMDetectedResultEgress

description: The authentication status of the VM
authenticating(1) an authentication is currently in progress
authenticatedNetwork(2) the VM has been authenticated by a network source
authenticatedLocally(3) the VM bas been authenticated by the local database
denied(4) the VM was either explicitly denied entry
notAuthenticated(5) the authentication process timed out or was never attempted.
variables.name: EXTREME-VM-MIB::extremeVMDetectedOperStatus

description: Displays the list of failed ingress policies
variables.name: EXTREME-VM-MIB::extremeVMDetectedIngErrPolicies

description: Displays the list of failed egress policies
variables.name: EXTREME-VM-MIB::extremeVMDetectedEgrErrPolicies

description: Indicates the result of VPP associated with VM MAC.
vppMapped(1) indicates that the named VPP was mapped.
vppNotMapped(2) indicates that the no VPP was mapped.
vppInvalid(3) indicates that the VPP mapped was invalid.
vppMissing(4) indicates that the VPP mapped was missing.
variables.name: EXTREME-VM-MIB::extremeVMDetectedVPPResult

description: The name of the VPP applied (or attempted to apply) to this virtual machine.
variables.name: EXTREME-VM-MIB::extremeVMDetectedVPPName

description: Indicates the result of whether dynamic counter
installed for this VM.
ingress-only(1) - Dynamic counters are installed to count packet source MAC address matches VM MAC.
egress-only(2) - Dynamic counters are installed to count packet destination MAC address matches VM MAC.
both(3) - Dynamic counters are installed to count packet source/destination MAC address matches VM MAC.
none(0) - Dynamic counters are not installed.
variables.name: EXTREME-VM-MIB::extremeVMDetectedCounterInstallResult

description: This notification is generated after a VM is undetected (removed) from a port.
objects.test: $SNMPTRAPCMD EXTREME-VM-MIB::extremeVMUnDetectResult EXTREME-VM-MIB::extremeVMDetectedMAC s EXAMPL EXTREME-VM-MIB::extremeVMDetectedIfIndex i 9999

description: The MAC address associated with the Virtual Machine. Note that a VM may have multiple MAC addresses.
variables.name: EXTREME-VM-MIB::extremeVMDetectedMAC

description: The value of ifIndex on which this virtual machine was detected.
variables.name: EXTREME-VM-MIB::extremeVMDetectedIfIndex
